title: Easy Keyboard Shortcuts to Disable a Chromebook Touch Screen

steps.title: Open Google Chrome on your Chromebook.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome on your Chromebook. The Google Chrome icon looks like a small blue circle in a larger multicolor circle.

steps.title: Type chrome://flags/#ash-debug-shortcuts into the URL bar.
steps.content: Type chrome://flags/#ash-debug-shortcuts into the URL bar. Then press enter on your keyboard to open the flags menu. [1] X Research source You can also copy and paste the link into your URL bar.

steps.title: Click Disabled next to “Debugging keyboard shortcuts.”
steps.content: Click Disabled next to “Debugging keyboard shortcuts.” This will open a drop-down menu with the option to enable the shortcuts. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select Enabled in the drop-down menu.
steps.content: Select Enabled in the drop-down menu. Now the debugging keyboard shortcuts will be activated next time you restart your Chromebook. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click Restart at the bottom of the screen.
steps.content: Click Restart at the bottom of the screen. This blue button will appear after changing the “Debugging keyboard settings” to “Enabled.” [4] X Research source

steps.title: Press Shift+Search+T on your keyboard.
steps.content: Press Shift + Search + T on your keyboard. This will disable touch screen. To enable touch screen, press the shortcut combination again. [5] X Research source Now you can get back to work (or watching videos)! Try splitting your screen and using the Search key to increase your productivity. If you also want to disable the touchpad, such as when you're using a mouse with your Chromebook, press Shift + Search + P . Pressing this combo a second time will reenable the touchpad.
